Title: Series: Tableaux, statues, bas-reliefs et camées de la galerie de Florence et du palais Pitti
Description: Holy Family with St Francis; a draped Virgin Mary, sitting under a tree, holding the naked Child in her lap; next to them Joseph, pulling down a branch of the tree, handing some dates to the Child with his other hand; St Francis kneeling next to the Family; in a forest. c.1789/1807 Etching and engraving
Curator's comments: Print after Correggio's Holy Family with St Francis, formerly in the church of San Francesco, Correggio, sent to Florence in 1649, now in the Galleria degli Uffizi, Florence. See Gould, 1976, p. 208-209 According to Mussini, the print is part of the volume "Tableaux, statues, bas-reliefs...de la Galerie de Florence" (see 1848,1125.561 for comment), where it appeared as plate number 1 in volume 3. This plate lacks the title ascribed to it in Mussini. See "Correggio Tradotto", 1995, p. 99.
Associated names: Representation of: St Francis of Assisi
Acquisition notes: From Richard Ford's collection of prints after Correggio (1837,0408.14 to 669), purchased from him through Colnaghi's, for £250.
